Title: AtCoder Regular Contest 190 (Div. 1)
Name: Matrix Pow Sum
Problem Statement:
You are given a prime number p and an N \times N matrix A = (A_{i,j}) (1≤ i,j≤ N). Each element of A is an integer between 0 and p-1, inclusive.
Consider a matrix B obtained by replacing each zero in A with an integer between 1 and p-1, inclusive. There are (p-1)^K such matrices B, where K is the number of zeros in A.
Find each element, modulo p, of the sum of B^p over all possible B.
Constraints:
- 1 ≤ N ≤ 100
- p is a prime such that 1 ≤ p ≤ 10^9.
- 0 ≤ A_{i,j} ≤ p-1
- All input values are integers.
IO Styles:
Input
The input is given from Standard Input in the following format:
N p
A_{1,1} \cdots A_{1,N}
\vdots
A_{N,1} \cdots A_{N,N}
Output
Print N lines.
The i-th line should contain, in the order j=1,...,N, the (i,j) element of the sum, modulo p, of B^p over all possible B, separated by spaces.
